result.execSummary:
The defendant John H Severson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
4:02 pm cases called. 14CF161, 16CF220, & 16TR2915. Defendant John H Severson in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Defendant John H Severson in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16CF220- Amended criminal complaint addressed-Attorney Stamman confirms receipt, waives formal reading.  Preliminary Hearing discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause, and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Stamman confirms receipt, waives formal reading.  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 3 & dismisses and reads-in Count 2 & 16TR2915. 
14CF161-Court questions defendant regarding PPDA-defendant agrees there was a material breach of agreement. Court finds material breach and vacates the PPDA and accepts NC plea previously entered. Revocation and order and warrant received on 14CF161. No errors or corrections.  Both cases now postured for sentencing. Sentencing argument by DA Blader Sentencing argument by Attorney Stamman.  Statement by Defendant. Statement by Court. 
14CF161- CT 1 & CT 3- 5 months Count 1-30 days on Count 3-with 56 days credit for time served. Concurrent to each other. Court re-imposes costs not previously paid. CT 2-12 months WCJ with Huber and Good Time credit. Credit for 1 day Time Served. Concurrent to any sentence. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 
16CF220- SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: 12 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 56 days served. Concurrent to 14CF161. To begin immediately. $1500.00 fine plus $42.50 Blood Draw Fee, 36 months DL revocation, 36 months IID, OWI Assessment. AODA and follow through. Absolute sobriety, not to be on the premises of any bars, and the defendant is prohibited from possessing and/or ingesting any impairing substances unless prescribed by a treating physician. Terms of Agent. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
from Atty Stamman, Dated 12/1/2016 Re: Sentence Credit
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on December 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. 14CF161 - Motion hearing to track along with new pending charges. STC Scheduled - NOH Given. Case Called @ 3:23 PM: Defendant John H Severson in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur w/recital.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO filed - receipt admitted - reading waived.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Meds serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Consequences explained for violating terms of Ct 2 PPDA.  Court accepts State's motion to amend as to Ct 1 to Mis Level POT contary to s. 961.41(3g)(e) No Enhancer offense Plea:  NC   Plea Ct 3 POP:  NC   Court accepts pleas and enters JOC as to Cts 1 and 3 only.  Plea Ct 2 as charged:  NC.   As to Ct 2:  Accepts terms of PPDA as introduced - matter sayted for 2 yrs.  Def reminded that bond remains in effect during pendency of PPDA.  Statement by Def prior to SEH - none offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution - S/W - 2 yrs probation. Conditions:  Ab Sob; Bar Prohibiton; No Poss of impairing substances unless prescribed by physician; AODA and any follow thru; court costs.  Appeal Rights Given.
